LEAD: Mr. and Mrs. Hiroshi Nakachi of Tokyo have announced August wedding plans for their daughter Mari Nakachi and Daniel A. Simkowitz, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Simkowitz of Bloomington, Ind.
Mr. and Mrs. Hiroshi Nakachi of Tokyo have announced August wedding plans for their daughter Mari Nakachi and Daniel A. Simkowitz, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Simkowitz of Bloomington, Ind.

Ms. Nakachi, 26 years old, graduated from Harvard University in 1987, as did her fiance, and received a law degree from the University of Virginia. She expects to join the New York law firm of Hughes, Hubbard & Reed in the fall.

Her father is a partner in Tohmatsu & Company, an accounting firm in Tokyo. He was a founding partner of the company's New York office and is a vice president of the Japanese Institute of Certified Public Accountants. Her mother, Katsuko Nakachi, is a professor of English at Tsuru Bunka University and Kyoritsu Women's College in Tokyo. The future bride is a niece of Taki Fujita, the president of the League of Women Voters of Japan and the first Japanese woman to be a delegate to the General Assembly of the United Nations.

Mr. Simkowitz, 25, is studying for an M.B.A. degree at Columbia University. His father is a professor of finance and the director of alumni affairs at the Indiana University Graduate School of Business.
